quote: Truth is beauty
author: Lisi Harrison

quote: A truth that no one knows is still the truth.
author: Sharon Shinn,  Jenna Starborn

quote: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.
author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song

quote: The only truth was whatever you could make someone believe.
author: Megan Chance,  The Spiritualist

quote: Love truth, but pardon error.
author: Voltaire

quote: The truth comes to me. The truth loves me.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: The truth is what I cherish and that's my strength
author: Sophocles,  Oedipus Rex

quote: truth is that which makes a people certain, clear, and strong.
author: Martin Heidegger

quote: there's only one truth!
author: Felix Y. Siauw,  Beyond The Inspiration

quote: Your personal truth is your gift to the world.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

quote: Nothing but truth is immortal.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  The Ghosts and Other Lectures

quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
author: Stephanie Klein,  Straight Up and Dirty

quote: The truth is the kindest thing we can give folks in the end.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Truth builds trust.
author: Marilyn Suttle

quote: The only truth is music.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Facts are the enemy of truth.
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: My truth could be very different than your truth.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Truth can never be told so as to be understood and not be believed.
author: William Blake

quote: Truth can only be seen by those with truth in them.
author: Suzy Kassem

quote: The truth is more important than the facts.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: With the truth, all given facts harmonize; but with what is false, the truth soon hits a wrong note.
author: Aristotle,  The Nicomachean Ethics

quote: The sad truth is the truth is sad.
author: Lemony Snicket,  The Hostile Hospital

quote: There is no truth except the truth that exists within you. Everything else is what someone is telling you.
author: Neale Donald Walsch,  Home with God: In a Life That Never Ends

quote: Every person must choose how much truth he can stand.
author: Irvin D. Yalom,  When Nietzsche Wept

quote: I like the truth, even when it does trouble me.
author: Juliet Marillier,  Wildwood Dancing

quote: Truth is irrelevant; what matters is what people believe.
author: Henry Mosquera,  Sleeper's Run

quote: The truth is the last thing that matters,' she said. 'And you can believe one thing of the truth and me: I keep it well hidden, inside my heart.
author: Philippa Gregory,  The Virgin's Lover

quote: The truth brings no man a fortune.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.
author: William Blake,  Auguries of Innocence

quote: In wine, there's truth.
author: Pliny the Elder,  Natural History

quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Answers based in truth are the foundation of wisdom.
author: Jayce O'Neal

quote: Some truths are truths, no matter who says them.
author: Patricia Briggs,  Raven's Strike

quote: Truth is a matter of the imagination.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Left Hand of Darkness

quote: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching

quote: Lies vs. Truth [10w] I can only speak truth if I lie to myself.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Truth is what is true, and it's not necessarily factual. Truth and fact are not the same thing. Truth does not contradict or deny facts, but it goes through and beyond facts. This is something that it is very difficult for some people to understand. Truth can be dangerous.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: I always tell the truth. Even when I lie.
author: Al Pacino

quote: The truth is helpless when up against perception
author: Zack W. Van

quote: Truth is not as pompous and romantic as myth ... but it has the immeasurable value of being the Truth.
author: Felix Alba-Juez,  E=mc^2: The Most Famous Equation in History... and its Folklore

quote: Initially, the truth may hurt, but lies hurt always.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You are beholdenTo the truthIt is the wayIt is the pathIt is your destinyTo be trueIs to be
author: Karen Hackel,  The Whisper of Your Soul

quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Truth is not a matter of fact but a state of harmony with progress and hope. Enveloped only in its wings will we ever soar to the promise of our greater selves.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: Does truth have a moral?
author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

quote: You are the ultimate truth of your life. Everything that happens to you depends on you and your thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You can believe in whatsoever you like, but the truth remains the truth, no matter how sweet the lie may taste.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: Learning the truth has become my life's love.
author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code

quote: Truth is ever to be found in the simplicity, and not in the multiplicity and confusion of things.
author: Isaac Newton
